experience: You and Amy both know Jamie Vaccaro Harris, George Polzer, and 15 others
Amy started at Swiftpage 8 years and 7 months before you did

•	Lead team of QA professionals in an agile environment with multiple emarketing products in development •	Ensure stories, QA tasks and test cases are clearly written to help the team meet defined goals•	Work closely with software developers to provide input and feedback prior to releases in order to minimize defects •	Execute QA processes and regression testing in two-week sprints  •	Test application program interfaces in order to catch problems•	Create and implement test plans for production releases•	QA processes to ensure testing is complete per set requirements•	Deploy code to test servers •	Correspond with product owners on the status of completed releases •	Demo company-wide sprint release changes

March 2, 2017, Amy worked with Brandon in the same group

Amy Webb is one of the rare people that demonstrates excellence in every aspect of her job, going above and beyond to meet deadlines and deliver world-class customer experiences. As a QA Lead, she has an excellent understanding of the agile development lifecycle and a keen eye for defects in both code and process, greatly reducing defects and ERs, which in turn significantly cuts costs in application development. In addition, she manages to test and review code from six different developers by herself every sprint, further proving how hard and proficiently she works. It is with great confidence and without reservation, and with these things in mind, that I can recommend Amy for any senior QA or QA management roles.
